tmf
[Groovy] Class Iu

java.lang.Object
  tmf.Iu

class Iu

An Information Unit object stores a piece of information of a Structural Node. Its semantic is similar to an attribute of a Freeplane map node. It is defined in ISO 16642.

Authors:
Stephane Aubry
See Also:
Sn

Field Detail

dataCategory

private String dataCategory
dataCategory semantic is similar to the attribute name of a Freeplane map node. The main standard regarding the meaning of Data Categories is ISO 12620. Concerning the string value representing a Data Category, the homepage http://www.isocat.org is inspiring.

informationUnits

private List informationUnits
informationUnits contains the list of Information Units which refines the current object. For example: An Information Unit having Data Category = 'usage note' may refine an Information Unit having Data Category = 'term'.

type

private String type
type comes from XML Schemas part 2: Datatypes It depends on the Data Category. Note: Currently, the MIXED type is not supported.

value

private String value
value is the actual content of the Information Unit.

 
Constructor Detail

Iu

Iu(String dataCategory, String type, String value)
Constructs an Information Unit and sets its 3 members.
Parameters:
dataCategory - The Data Category, as in ISO 12620
type - The value type, as in XML Schemas part 2: Datatypes
value - The content value

equals

boolean equals(Object obj)
Tests whether two Information Units are equal.

Returns:
True if the two Information Units are equal, false otherwise.

toGmt

def toGmt(MarkupBuilder xml)
Outputs the Information Unit in an XML format. The format is named GMT (Generic Mapping Tool) and is specified in ISO 16642. The Information Unit is transformed into an XML element named feat. The xml:lang attribute of the feat element is not handled. Thus, this method should NOT be used if the value of the Information Unit is expressed in a human language. This method should be used instead.
Parameters:
xml - MarkupBuilder

toGmt

def toGmt(MarkupBuilder xml, Map attributes)
Outputs the Information Unit in an XML format. The format is named GMT (Generic Mapping Tool) and is specified in ISO 16642. The Information Unit is transformed into an XML element named feat. The xml:lang attribute is inserted in the feat element if necessary. This method should be used if the value of the Information Unit is expressed in a human language. For example, values of the partOfSpeech are usually expressed in English (adjective, noun, verb, etc). Thus, this method should be used to produce the corresponding feat XML element.
Parameters:
xml - MarkupBuilder
attributes - Map of contextual attributes. This context is used to set the xml:lang attribute. String Iu.dataCategory as key. String Iu.value as value.
